name: preside
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to be in charge of a formal meeting, ceremony, or trial: Who would be the best person to preside at/over the public enquiry? Judge Langdale is to preside over the official enquiry into the case.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to be in charge of or to control a meeting or event: The vice president will preside at today’s meeting.
Add to word list
Add to word list
to be in charge of a formal meeting or ceremony: preside at sth The Chairman shall preside at meetings of the stockholders. Phrasal verb
preside over sth
